text:
And you will have days where you will have 0 conversions as well. Thats just how marketing works, for some strange reason on a certain day people dont want to buy.

Happened recently as well, one of our clients is selling chocolates online and their store revenue dipped from 1 L per day to like 30 k per day. I blamed the Ukraine war, im like who wants to buy chocolates when all this is happening in the world

text:
I believe hiring is always a two-way street. The war of blame game will never end here. Some say the HRs are ghosting, others say the candidates are ghosting.

I empathise both the sides - because I am not just an HR but an employee too. I also sit for interviews and negotiate for my own salary and want good benefits.

The main key is to keep the other person informed. You got a better offer today - call the HR and let them know instead of backing out a week before joining. You are still re-considering offers - let your hiring team know.

Public shaming isn't the best way to go, I believe. Also, if you don't believe in the values of how one runs a company, it's better to not go there altogether.

text: My thought is that after hitting a certain threshold, companies need offline presence for further growth especially for high touch stuff like Lenskart, Zivame, education etc. or high ticket items like caratlane types.
